page.title: 12HARVEL CRICKET CLUB
page.content: The Harvel Cricket Club celebrated its Centenary in 1972. Cricket has been played on 3 different fields within the village. The present site, called the Desmond Wood Ground after a former President, is beside the Amazon and Tiger pub and was first used in 1928. The club normally plays against local villages, but has had several unusual opponents such as The D'Oyley Carte Opera Company and the Israeli National Team. Harvel fields 5 senior and 2 junior teams, and there is a weekly open night for youngsters wishing to learn the game. On Saturday League Cricket is with us, and played in a serious vein by the 1st X1. But come Sunday,real village cricket is played in what must be one of the most beautiful settings in Kent. The Club's Committee is planning to purchase the ground and construct a new pavilion.
